alert.note: Alert for Western Columbia River Gorge (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued November 17 at 10:05AM PST until November 18 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...East winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 60 mph expected at freeway level. Speeds 35 to 50 mph with gusts to 70 to 90 mph at most exposed areas such as Corbett and Crown Point. * WHERE...In Oregon, Western Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, Western Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...Until 7 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
